content.description: Figure 1 illustrates a model of the molecules involved in <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> replication and their placement relative to each other.
content.question: Figure 1. Model including molecules involved in <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></math> replication Which of the following correctly explains where <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> replication will begin on the strand oriented <math alttext="5 prime to 3 prime" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>′</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>′</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, reading from left to right?

choices.label: <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> replication will be randomly initiated along the unwound portion of the <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> strand since base pairing will occur.

<math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> replication cannot occur since there is already <math alttext="R N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>RNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> base pairing with the template strand.

<math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> replication will be initiated immediately to the left of the <math alttext="R N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>RNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, since <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> polymerase requires an <math alttext="R N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>RNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> primer.

<math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> replication will be initiated at the site of the topoisomerase since that is where <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext><mtext></mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> begins to uncoil.

content.answer: <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> replication will be initiated immediately to the left of the <math alttext="R N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>RNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, since <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> polymerase requires an <math alttext="R N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>RNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> primer.

skill.text: 2.B: Explain relationships between characteristics of biological models in both theoretical and applied contexts.
